captions.text:
-Those are my files.
-Yeah. We had them couriered over.

Listen, good work.
They're a great start.

We'll just spend some time
filling in the holes in your research.

Excuse me-- Theresa, is it?
There are no holes in my research.

There are things we need
you probably didn't know to ask.
Don't talk to me like I'm an idiot.
I spent 1 8 months on this case...

...and I know more about
the plaintiffs than you ever will.
You don't even have phone numbers.
Whose number do you need?

Everyone's. We need to be
able to contact the plaintiffs.
I said whose number do you need?
You don't know 600 numbers by heart.
Annabelle Daniels.
Annabelle Daniels. 71 4-454-9346.

Ten years old. Lived
on the plume since birth.

Wanted to be a synchronized swimmer,
so she spent every minute in the pool.
They detected a tumour in her brain.

An operation shrunk it,
with radiation after that.
Her parents are Ted and Rita.

Ted's got Crohn's disease. Rita has
headaches and underwent a hysterectomy.

Ted grew up in Hinkley. His
brother and his wife and their kids...

...Robbie Jr., Martha, Ed, Rose
and Peter also lived on the plume.
Their number is 454-9554.
You want their diseases?
I think we got off on the wrong foot.

That's all you got, lady, two
wrong feet in fucking ugly shoes.

title: Two Wrong Feet in Ugly Shoes - Erin Brockovich (7/10) Movie CLIP (2000) HD

comments.text:
A bit of an attitude +Kurt Ishallman ...n I'll tell u my phone number when 
I was 5years old.﻿
comments.author: Angela Ronson

comments.text:
Lots of simple math-mostly addition. I will get "stuck" on adding one 
thing, like an autistic person gets stuck on an idea. I will have to add it 
over n over. I'll even use different math routes (subtraction, n sometimes 
multiplication if applicable). I mostly put the numbers in the context of 
everyday life, tho-statistics. Probability fascinates me.
   Memorizing comes easier if I'm not consciously trying to memorize. 
Mostly I write n I know A LOT of things. I'm like a living, breathing 
encyclopedia.
   +Darold Treffert, M.D. I've been like this since I was little, n I'm 
prolly more now. I might have already been mild savant n had a severe brain 
injury. (Now that's a different twist.)
http://thoughtfulveg.blogspot.com/2014/07/i-havent-enjoyed-it.html
comments.author: Angela Ronson

comments.text: I meant are numbers still easy for you to memorize?

comments.author: SRT480

comments.text:
+Jackie Bush Whoa there, calm down. But I didn't interpret it that she was 
underestimating Erin's intelligence at all, just that Erin wouldn't have 
known certain things about the people due to lack of knowledge to ask. And 
intelligence is different from knowledge. Erin could be plenty smart to be 
a lawyer, but if she doesn't know specific questions to ask, then she might 
still not have compiled all the necessary information.
comments.author: Kyle Blank

comments.text:
Have you seen the movie? If you have, then you missed the point! That 
lawyer underestimated Erin's intelligence just because she wasn't a lawyer! 
It turns out that Erin proved her wrong by memorizing each and ever 
plaintiff's name, address, phone # and personal history by showing her what 
a know it all idiot she was by telling her off! The point is all you need 
is common sense rather than graduating from Law School!
comments.author: Jackie Bush

comments.text:
I think J Wraith is correct, that she overreacted. The lawyer woman wasn't 
talking to her like she was an idiot, she was stating what well could have 
been a fact, which was that there could have been things that she didn't 
know to ask the plaintiffs.
comments.author: Kyle Blank

comments.text:
Teresa was way out of line for underestimating Erin! So Teresa deserved it! 
If I were Erin, I probably would have been a bitch to her too! Sometimes 
rudeness is the only way to get through to snobs like that!

comments.text:
+leonkennedy1259
**Well ONLY 3 people liked your post and 17 people like mine.**
Well that settles it; you're right and I'm wrong. lol.

**What does that tell you about my comment and your comment?**
Umm, it says that most people who click on a video clip from "Erin 
Brockovich" probably like the movie "Erin Brockovich" and therefore 
naturally you would have more support. 

**That people agree with me and think I'm right and your comment wasn't as 
great.**
I'll try to survive the disappointment. 

 **I'm sure only snobs assh*les had liked yours. It's immature.** 
Nope, immature would be saying "look..look, more people liked my comment so 
that means I'M RIGHT!"
I'm not going to argue with you. If you believe that acting like a total 
bitch is the same as being a "strong woman" and if that's the goal you want 
to aspire to then that's fine.
comments.author: J Wraith

comments.text:
+J Wraith Well ONLY 3 people liked your post and 17 people like mine. What 
does that tell you about my comment and your comment? That people agree 
with me and think I'm right and your comment wasn't as great. I'm sure only 
snobs assh*les had liked yours. Jerks usually like posts of people calling 
other people B*tches. It's immature.
comments.author: leonkennedy1259

comments.text:
+degree7
**That's the irony of having to stick up for yourself. People just assume 
you're being overly defensive**
Particularly when you in fact ARE being overly-defensive. 

**and then you magically become the asshole.**
Not magically, quite naturally.
comments.author: J Wraith

comments.text:
+leonkennedy1259
**It was the other way around. Everybody was a "b*tch" as you say to Erin.**
No..actually if you watch the movie she was the total bitch to pretty much 
everyone and completely overreacted to extremely minor situations. 

**Erin was just sticking up for herself and saying yes I may not have a law 
degree but I'm not dumb like you see here.**
No one was calling her "dumb." She again overreacted. The fact that you 
empathize with her is an obvious sign that you yourself likely overreact to 
things as well.  

**The other lady was severely rude**
No she wasn't. She merely and politely stated that perhaps her files 
weren't complete. 

**People like me with no self esteem could only dream to stick up for 
ourselves like that.**
Well if you goal is to become completely hysterical over every little thing 
and show your boobs as a means to manipulate people then go for it. What an 
amazing person you'll be.
comments.author: J Wraith

comments.text:
That's the irony of having to stick up for yourself. People just assume 
you're being overly defensive, and then you magically become the asshole. 
Amazing.
comments.author: degree7

comments.text:
Umm.. are you trolling? It really sounds like you're trolling. It was the 
other way around. Everybody was a "b*tch" as you say to Erin. Erin was just 
sticking up for herself and saying yes I may not have a law degree but I'm 
not dumb like you see here. The other lady was severely rude and implied 
she was this and that. Erin could have avoided swearing but everything else 
with the phone numbers and everything else she did in the movie was needed. 
She just added her pizzazz to it which made it even better. People like me 
with no self esteem could only dream to stick up for ourselves like that. 
That's one of the reasons I love this movie. She's badass and she gives me 
hope and strength. She's one I could look up to to be strong when I need to 
be. She's quite awesome. :)
comments.author: leonkennedy1259
